availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Wheeler (Christian County, KY, physician, farmer, and prov govt conv rep )

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, physician and farmer. Native of England. Married to Elizabeth S. Wheeler. Father of William G. Wheeler, Mary S. Wheeler, James J. Wheeler, Elizabeth S. Wheeler, Sarah E. Wheeler, Susan K. Wheeler, Virginia E. Wheeler, John Wheeler, Laura Wheeler, Joel W. Wheeler, Charles K. Wheeler, and Emma Wheeler. Physician in Christian County in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Physician and farmer in Christian County in 1860. Owned thirty-five enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.
